intro: Drypetes usambarica, commonly known as the Usambara drypetes, is a small to medium-sized tree native to the tropical regions of East Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks.
